title: Mckinsey & Company
description: As a Software Engineer Consultant at McKinsey, I developed and implemented versatile tech solutions for clients across various industries, highlighting my adaptability. I led Generation AI initiatives, working with a diverse client base to facilitate the early adoption of Gen AI tools. This effort boosted developer efficiency by 50%. Additionally, I coached both client and McKinsey developers in effective Gen AI tool use, achieving a 40% week-on-week increase in adoption rates.

title: Purdue University
description: Graduated from Purdue University with a Bachelor's degree in Computer & Information Technology.

title: Pantsuit Professionals
description: As an SDE Intern at Pantsuit Professional, I designed and engineered a client-side user login and registration module for an Android application using the MVC framework, improving code efficiency and maintainability. Working closely with UI/UX designers, Android engineers, and the business team, I gained a deep understanding of application requirements. Additionally, I conducted code reviews for fellow interns' projects, offering constructive feedback to ensure best coding practices and project requirements were met, fostering a collaborative learning environment within the team.

title: Deloitte
description: As an Emerging Tech Intern at Deloitte, I played a crucial role in our technical consultancy team. My tasks included data analysis to inform solution development, researching emerging technologies to spot innovation opportunities, and contributing to detailed project proposals. This work involved clear client communication regarding time estimates, cost projections, and services, ensuring we provided strategic tech consulting to drive client growth and innovation.

title: Purdue University
description: Started my undergraduate degree in Computer & Information Technoloy at Purdue University in West Lafayette, IN.
